onyomiExamples.meaning: practice, practising, exercises, manoeuvres, maneuvers, seminar (student debates, presentations, etc.), practicum

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to take lessons in, to be taught, to learn (from a teacher), to study (under a teacher), to get training in
experience is the best teacher, custom makes all things easy, you learn best by doing, practice makes perfect, it is better to grow accustomed than to be taught
as is habit, the way life normally is
accomplishment, lessons (in an art, skill, etc.), practice
apprenticeship, probation, learning by observation, apprentice, trainee, probationer
learning good manners through apprenticeship (to an upper-class family)
